com.ecs.utils
Class Log

java.lang.Object
  com.ecs.utils.Log
public class Log
extends java.lang.Object

Log contains all the Logging methods you should use in custom code. Logging uses log4j and when the initial log call is made a monitor is set up on a log file determined by the ECS_LOG_CONFIG_LOCATION environment variable.

To setup the ECS_LOG_CONFIG_LOCATION variable add it to the JVM startup line in the form:
-DECS_LOG_CONFIG_LOCATION=c:/stellent/idcm1/log.config.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Gordon Sandeman

Constant Field Values
Method Detail

setThreadId

public static void setThreadId(java.lang.String id)
Adds a secondary thread identifier for logging (such as a user name). If using a secondary identifier ensure that removeThreadId() is called in a finally at the end of the process to ensure logging remains consistent.

Parameters:
id -

removeThreadId

public static void removeThreadId()
Removes a secondary thread identifier from the thread.

debug

public static void debug(java.lang.String msg)
Output a debug message. A debug message gives trace or high detail informational messages, only of use to developers. Messages used simply to dump contents of variables at various stages of an operation are debug.

Parameters:
msg - The message string to log

debug

public static void debug(java.lang.String msg,
                         java.lang.Throwable t)
Output a debug message. A debug message gives trace or high detail informational messages, only of use to developers. Messages used simply to dump contents of variables at various stages of an operation are debug.

Parameters:
msg - The message string to log
t - A Throwable whose stack trace and message is logged

debug

public static void debug(java.lang.String msg,
                         int level)
Output a debug message. A debug message gives trace or high detail informational messages, only of use to developers. Messages used simply to dump contents of variables at various stages of an operation are debug. debug2 call logs line with class name of calling classes calling class. Use this call when calling this class from a generic logger.

Parameters:
msg - The message string to log
level - If 0 passed then the class name of the calling class will be used when logging, if a positive value is passed then the log line will output the class at the equivalent level above the calling class.

                         int level)

info

public static void info(java.lang.String msg)
Output an informational message. This says that something important has happened, such as a document being created or checked in, or a high level method has been called. Info level messages should never be used if something has gone wrong.

Parameters:
msg - The message string to log

warn

public static void warn(java.lang.String msg)
Output a warning message. This says that something has gone wrong, but that the problem may not be important. For example, if FileUtils fails to read a document's contents, then that is a warning level message. If this then causes a document checkout to fail, then a seperate error level message will be raised at a higher level. Invalid arguments and unexpected conditions should also raise warnings.

Parameters:
msg - The message string to log

warn

public static void warn(java.lang.String msg,
                        int level)
Output a warning message. This says that something has gone wrong, but that the problem may not be important. For example, if FileUtils fails to read a document's contents, then that is a warning level message. If this then causes a document checkout to fail, then a seperate error level message will be raised at a higher level. Invalid arguments and unexpected conditions should also raise warnings.

Parameters:
msg - The message string to log
level - If 0 passed then the class name of the calling class will be used when logging, if a positive value is passed then the log line will output the class at the equivalent level above the calling class.

error

public static void error(java.lang.String msg)
Output an error message. An error message says that something has gone badly wrong, and that some task has failed. These should be reserved for messages raised at a high level - utility methods should not normally be using these. An error will most probably be proceeded by one or more warning messages.

Parameters:
msg - The message string to log

error

public static void error(java.lang.String msg,
                         int level)
Output an error message. An error message says that something has gone badly wrong, and that some task has failed. These should be reserved for messages raised at a high level - utility methods should not normally be using these. An error will most probably be proceeded by one or more warning messages.

Parameters:
msg - The message string to log
level - If 0 passed then the class name of the calling class will be used when logging, if a positive value is passed then the log line will output the class at the equivalent level above the calling class.

doHouseKeeping

public static void doHouseKeeping()
Force Log4J to tidy up references to dead threads. Not doing this means you can get memory leaks.
